newsitem.title: UK: Britain says endorses EU stance on Iran.
newsitem.headline: Britain says endorses EU stance on Iran.

text.p: Britain said on Thursday it "wholeheartedly" endorsed the European Union's invitation for member states to withdraw their ambassadors from Iran.

The EU condemned Iran and said there was no basis to continue its "critical dialogue" with the country after a German court accused Iranian leaders of ordering the killing of exiled Kurdish dissidents in Berlin. Iran rejected the German ruling.

"We will give maximum support to Germany in the aftermath of the judgement," Britain's Foreign Office said in a statement. "We will work actively with the Dutch Presidency and our EU partners to agree a firm response."
Britain's relations with Iran were complicated by the death threat, or fatwa, imposed on British author Salman Rushdie by Iran's late spiritual leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini in 1989.
Rushdie says Britain's participation in the European "critical dialogue" with Iran has made little progress in lifting the fatwa, and has frequently urged the EU to take a tougher line.
